title: MCDONALD, VIVIAN
text:
Vivian McDonald
August 23, 2024
Vivian McDonald (nee Krause), age 84, passed away on August 23, 2024, in long term care near her daughters in Ontario. Born at home in Gravelbourg, SK, she moved to Edmonton in the early 1960s then proudly resided in Calgary for over 50 years. Vivian supported the community, and donated countless hours to Calgary Meals on Wheels, Girl Guides, the Canadian Cancer Society and the Diabetes Association.
Viv was an independent woman, who loved family, the Calgary Flames, and having a laugh. She raised her children through hard work and by putting herself through school, and was strong for them until the end. She is survived by many siblings, her children Mary Lou, Diane and Brian, and their families and loved ones.
The family will hold a private gathering for Vivian, and wish to thank the caregivers at Friendly Manor for all their care and love. Donations can be made in honour of Vivian to Calgary Meals on Wheels.

Plant a tree: How does it work
When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.
An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.
After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.
Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.
Tree Planting Timeline
Orders placed in:
January - May
Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.
June - December
Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
